comments.raw_text:
there are a couple of mime types that come from operating systems being "helpful", the result is awful.

browsing through http://rajscript.com/index.php?topic=373.0, i think:

.log => text/x-log
.cnf/.conf => text/x-config
.sql => text/x-sql

offhand, if people feel there's some value in sending these wonky types, then i guess the thing to do is to change the browser to treat them as text/plain upon receipt.

This would enable firefox users of bugzilla.mozilla.org to not get painful behavior when users attach .log's to bugzilla.

However, as I use safari often, I'd rather have these mime types mapped to text/plain when firefox uploads to bugzilla so that when i click the links in safari I don't get lame behavior from it.
comments.author: timeless@bemail.org
